name: Deutsche Energie-Agentur (dena)
membership: Beispiele: EnR, World Energy Council, aireg, Baltic Sea Forum, Deutsch-Französischer Wirtschaftskreis, Deutsch-Russisches Forum e.V., Osteuropaverein, enercity, EWI, VDA, erdgas mobil
goal: dena is Germany’s centre of expertise for energy efficiency, renewable energy sources and intelligent energy systems. As 'Agency for Applied Energy Transition', it contributes to attaining the goals of energy and climate politics by developing solutions and putting them into practice, both nationally and internationally. In order to do this, it brings together partners from all areas of politics, business, academia and civil society. dena’s shareholders are the Federal Republic of Germany and the KfW Group.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Energy Union, 2030 Energy & Climate Framework, EED, EPBD, RED and Concerted Actions; Covenant of Mayors, Governance & Cohesion Policy, H2020,
